info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 28 at 1:56PM CDT until July 31 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Aberdeen SD
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota...
Big Sioux River Near Castlewood affecting Hamlin County.
Willow Creek near Watertown affecting Codington County.
South Branch Tributary Mud Creek near Rauville affecting Codington County.
...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in South Dakota...
Mud Creek near Rauville affecting Codington County.
.For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Big Sioux River near Castlewood.
* WHEN...Until Thursday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Significant amounts of pasture and other agricultural lands will be flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM CDT Monday the stage was 10.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:45 PM CDT Monday was 10.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr.
The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 300 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING
